text: Tlatoani ( ; plural , ) is the Nahuatl word for the ruler of an altepetl, a pre-Hispanic state. The word means "speaker", but may be translated into English as "king".Lockhart (2001, p.238); Schroeder (2007, p.3). See also the entry for "TLAHTOANI" , in Wimmer (2006) A () is a female ruler.Schroeder (2007, pp.3â€“4). See also the entry for "CIHUATLAHTOANI" in Wimmer (2006). ==References== Category:Kings and queens Category:Mexican people
title: Tlatoani
